title: Grilled Salmon with Lemon and Dill
promptIMG: Grilled salmon with lemon and dill, on plate, natural food photography, balanced sharp focus, zero blur throughout entire image, infinite depth of field, realistic food textures, modern kitchen background in sharp focus, natural lighting, kitchen countertop visible, even focus distribution, documentary food photography, natural sharpness --no blur, depth of field, bokeh, over-sharpening, artificial enhancement --quality 2 --raw --stylize 300
description: This Grilled Salmon with Lemon and Dill is a delightful dish that combines the freshness of herbs with the zesty flavor of lemon. Perfectly grilled, this salmon is not only healthy but also incredibly satisfying, making it a must-try for any seafood lover.
instructions: Marinate the salmon with lemon juice, fresh dill, and olive oil for 15 minutes.
Grill the salmon for 4-5 minutes on each side until cooked through.
tips: For the best results, ensure your grill is preheated and lightly oiled to prevent sticking. Use a meat thermometer to check for doneness.

structured_content.content: This Grilled Salmon with Lemon and Dill is a simple yet elegant dish that brings the taste of the ocean right to your table. The bright flavors of lemon and fresh dill elevate the natural richness of the salmon, making it a standout meal for any occasion.

note.label: Why You'll Love This Recipe
note.content:
• Quick and easy to make in under 30 minutes
  • Restaurant-quality flavors at home
  • Perfect for weeknight dinners or entertaining
  • Uses simple ingredients you likely have on hand
  • Healthy and packed with omega-3 fatty acids

structured_content.content: I remember the first time I made this dish for my family. The aroma of the grilling salmon filled the kitchen, and everyone gathered around the table, eager to dig in. It quickly became a family favorite!

• Main ingredient: Salmon fillets work best for grilling due to their rich flavor and firm texture.
  • Key seasonings/flavoring agents: Fresh dill adds a bright, herbal note, while lemon juice provides acidity that balances the richness of the fish.
  • Supporting ingredients: Olive oil ensures the salmon stays moist and enhances flavor.
  • Equipment needed: A grill or grill pan is essential for achieving that perfect char.

upload.context: Preparation of salmon fillets with lemon and dill, including keywords for this recipe

structured_content.content:
Preparation:
Start by marinating the salmon fillets in a mixture of lemon juice, chopped dill, and olive oil for about 15 minutes to infuse flavor.
Cooking/Baking Process:
Preheat your grill to medium-high heat. Grill the salmon for 4-5 minutes on each side, or until it flakes easily with a fork.
Finishing Touches:
Serve the grilled salmon with a sprinkle of fresh dill and lemon wedges on the side for an extra burst of flavor.

upload.context: Cooking process of grilling salmon, including keywords for this recipe

note.label: You Must Know
note.content:
• Grill the salmon skin-side down first to help it hold together.
  • A common mistake is overcooking the salmon; aim for an internal temperature of 145°F.
  • Look for the salmon to flake easily with a fork to know it's ready.
  • Store leftovers in an airtight container in the fridge for up to 3 days.

structured_content.content: This dish is always a hit when I share it with friends. It’s not just about the food; it’s about the laughter and stories shared around the table, making every meal a cherished memory.
For an extra kick, try adding some garlic or crushed red pepper to the marinade. You can also swap out dill for other fresh herbs like parsley or cilantro for a different flavor profile.
Pair this grilled salmon with steamed vegetables or a fresh salad for a light meal. A glass of white wine or sparkling water with lemon complements the dish beautifully.
For a gluten-free option, this recipe is naturally gluten-free. You can also try using different types of fish, such as trout or tilapia, for a variation on the classic.

upload.context: Final plated dish of grilled salmon with lemon and dill, including keywords for this recipe

note.label: Pro Tips
note.content:
• For restaurant-quality results, let the salmon rest for a few minutes after grilling.
  • Use fresh herbs for maximum flavor; dried herbs won't have the same impact.
  • Keep an eye on the grill to prevent flare-ups that can char the fish.
  • Garnish with lemon slices for an impressive presentation.

structured_content.content: Don't hesitate to try this recipe! The joy of grilling salmon with fresh flavors will leave you feeling accomplished and satisfied. Enjoy every bite!
